description: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, Phoebe, and Monica are there.

speaker: Monica
text: There’s nothing to tell! He’s just some guy I work with!

speaker: Joey
text: C’mon, you’re going out with the guy! There’s gotta be something wrong with him!

speaker: Chandler
text: All right Joey, be nice. So does he have a hump? A hump and a hairpiece?

speaker: Phoebe
text: Wait, does he eat chalk?
(They all stare, bemused.)

speaker: Phoebe
text: Just, ’cause, I don’t want her to go through what I went through with Carl- oh!

speaker: Monica
text: Okay, everybody relax. This is not even a date. It’s just two people going out to dinner and- not having sex.

speaker: Chandler
text: Sounds like a date to me.
[Time Lapse]

speaker: Chandler
text: Alright, so I’m back in high school, I’m standing in the middle of the cafeteria, and I realize I am totally naked.

speaker: All
text: Oh, yeah. Had that dream.

speaker: Chandler
text: Then I look down, and I realize there’s a phone… there.

speaker: Joey
text: Instead of…?

speaker: Chandler
text: That’s right.

speaker: Joey
text: Never had that dream.

speaker: Phoebe
text: No.

speaker: Chandler
text: All of a sudden, the phone starts to ring. Now I don’t know what to do, everybody starts looking at me.

speaker: Monica
text: And they weren’t looking at you before?!

speaker: Chandler
text: Finally, I figure I’d better answer it, and it turns out it’s my mother, which is very-very weird, because- she never calls me!
[Time Lapse, Ross has entered.]

speaker: Ross
text: Hi.

speaker: Joey
text: This guy says hello, I wanna kill myself.

speaker: Monica
text: Are you okay, sweetie?

speaker: Ross
text: I just feel like someone reached down my throat, grabbed my small intestine, pulled it out of my mouth and tied it around my neck…

speaker: Chandler
text: Cookie?

speaker: Monica
text: Carol moved her stuff out today.

speaker: Joey
text: Ohh.

speaker: Monica
text: Let me get you some coffee.

speaker: Ross
text: Thanks.

speaker: Phoebe
text: Ooh! Oh! (She starts to pluck at the air just in front of Ross.)

speaker: Ross
text: No, no don’t! Stop cleansing my aura! No, just leave my aura alone, okay?

speaker: Phoebe
text: Fine! Be murky!

speaker: Ross
text: I’ll be fine, alright? Really, everyone. I hope she’ll be very happy.

speaker: Monica
text: No you don’t.

speaker: Ross
text: No I don’t, to hell with her, she left me!

speaker: Joey
text: And you never knew she was a lesbian…

speaker: Ross
text: No!! Okay?! Why does everyone keep fixating on that? She didn’t know, how should I know?

speaker: Chandler
text: Sometimes I wish I was a lesbian… (They all stare at him.) Did I say that out loud?

speaker: Ross
text: I told mom and dad last night, they seemed to take it pretty well.

speaker: Monica
text: Oh really, so that hysterical phone call I got from a woman at sobbing 3:00 A.M., “I’ll never have grandchildren, I’ll never have grandchildren.” was what? A wrong number?

speaker: Ross
text: Sorry.

speaker: Joey
text: Alright Ross, look. You’re feeling a lot of pain right now. You’re angry. You’re hurting. Can I tell you what the answer is?
(Ross gestures his consent.)

speaker: Joey
text: Strip joint! C’mon, you’re single! Have some hormones!

speaker: Ross
text: I don’t want to be single, okay? I just… I just- I just wanna be married again!
(Rachel enters in a wet wedding dress and starts to search the room.)

speaker: Chandler
text: And I just want a million dollars! (He extends his hand hopefully.)

speaker: Monica
text: Rachel?!

speaker: Rachel
text: Oh God Monica hi! Thank God! I just went to your building and you weren’t there and then this guy with a big hammer said you might be here and you are, you are!

speaker: Waitress
text: Can I get you some coffee?

speaker: Monica
text: De-caff. (to All) Okay, everybody, this is Rachel, another Lincoln High survivor. (to Rachel) This is everybody, this is Chandler, and Phoebe, and Joey, and- you remember my brother Ross?

speaker: Rachel
text: Hi, sure!

speaker: Ross
text: Hi.
(They go to hug but Ross’s umbrella opens. He sits back down defeated again. A moment of silence follows as Rachel sits and the others expect her to explain.)

speaker: Monica
text: So you wanna tell us now, or are we waiting for four wet bridesmaids?

speaker: Rachel
text: Oh God… well, it started about a half hour before the wedding. I was in the room where we were keeping all the presents, and I was looking at this gravy boat. This really gorgeous Lamauge gravy boat. When all of a sudden- (to the waitress that brought her coffee)Sweet ‘n’ Lo?- I realized that I was more turned on by this gravy boat than by Barry! And then I got really freaked out, and that’s when it hit me: how much Barry looks like Mr. Potato Head. Y’know, I mean, I always knew looked familiar, but… Anyway, I just had to get out of there, and I started wondering ‘Why am I doing this, and who am I doing this for?’. (to Monica) So anyway I just didn’t know where to go, and I know that you and I have kinda drifted apart, but you’re the only person I knew who lived here in the city.

speaker: Monica
text: Who wasn’t invited to the wedding.

speaker: Rachel
text: Ooh, I was kinda hoping that wouldn’t be an issue… [Scene: Monica’s Apartment, everyone is there and watching a Spanish Soap on TV and are trying to figure out what is going on.]

speaker: Monica
text: Now I’m guessing that he bought her the big pipe organ, and she’s really not happy about it.

speaker: Chandler
text: Tuna or egg salad? Decide!

speaker: Ross
text: I’ll have whatever Christine is having.

speaker: Rachel
text: Daddy, I just… I can’t marry him! I’m sorry. I just don’t love him. Well, it matters to me!
(The scene on TV has changed to show two women, one is holding her hair.)

speaker: Phoebe
text: If I let go of my hair, my head will fall off.

speaker: Chandler
text: Ooh, she should not be wearing those pants.

speaker: Joey
text: I say push her down the stairs.

speaker: Phoebe, Ross, Chandler, and Joey
text: Push her down the stairs! Push her down the stairs! Push her down the stairs!
(She is pushed down the stairs and everyone cheers.)

speaker: Rachel
text: C’mon Daddy, listen to me! It’s like, it’s like, all of my life, everyone has always told me, ‘You’re a shoe! You’re a shoe, you’re a shoe, you’re a shoe!’. And today I just stopped and I said, ‘What if I don’t wanna be a shoe? What if I wanna be a- a purse, y’know? Or a- or a hat! No, I’m not saying I want you to buy me a hat, I’m saying I am a ha- It’s a metaphor, Daddy!

speaker: Ross
text: You can see where he’d have trouble.

speaker: Rachel
text: Look Daddy, it’s my life. Well maybe I’ll just stay here with Monica.

speaker: Monica
text: Well, I guess we’ve established who’s staying here with Monica…

speaker: Rachel
text: Well, maybe that’s my decision. Well, maybe I don’t need your money. Wait!! Wait, I said maybe!!
[Time Lapse, Rachel is breating into a paper bag.]

speaker: Monica
text: Just breathe, breathe.. that’s it. Just try to think of nice calm things…

speaker: Phoebe
text: Raindrops on roses and rabbits and kittens, (Rachel and Monica turn to look at her.) bluebells and sleighbells and- something with mittens… La la la la… something and noodles with string. These are a few…

speaker: Rachel
text: I’m all better now.

speaker: Phoebe
parenthetical: grins and walks to the kitchen and says to Chandler and Joey.
text: I helped!

speaker: Monica
text: Okay, look, this is probably for the best, y’know? Independence. Taking control of your life. The whole, ‘hat’ thing.

speaker: Joey
text: And hey, you need anything, you can always come to Joey. Me and Chandler live across the hall. And he’s away a lot.

speaker: Monica
text: Joey, stop hitting on her! It’s her wedding day!

speaker: Joey
text: What, like there’s a rule or something?
(The door buzzer sounds and Chandler gets it.)

speaker: Chandler
text: Please don’t do that again, it’s a horrible sound.

speaker: Paul
text: It’s, uh, it’s Paul.

speaker: Monica
text: Oh God, is it 6:30? Buzz him in!

speaker: Joey
text: Who’s Paul?

speaker: Ross
text: Paul the Wine Guy, Paul?

speaker: Monica
text: Maybe.

speaker: Joey
text: Wait. Your ‘not a real date’ tonight is with Paul the Wine Guy?

speaker: Ross
text: He finally asked you out?

speaker: Monica
text: Yes!

speaker: Chandler
text: Ooh, this is a Dear Diary moment.

speaker: Monica
text: Rach, wait, I can cancel…

speaker: Rachel
text: Please, no, go, that’d be fine!

speaker: Monica
text: Are, are you okay? I mean, do you want me to stay?

speaker: Ross
text: That’d be good…

speaker: Monica
text: Really?

speaker: Ross
text: No, go on! It’s Paul the Wine Guy!

speaker: Phoebe
text: What does that mean? Does he sell it, drink it, or just complain a lot? (Chandler doesn’t know.)
(There’s a knock on the door and it’s Paul.)

speaker: Monica
text: Hi, come in! Paul, this is.. (They are all lined up next to the door.)… everybody, everybody, this is Paul.

speaker: All
text: Hey! Paul! Hi! The Wine Guy! Hey!

speaker: Chandler
text: I’m sorry, I didn’t catch your name. Paul, was it?

speaker: Monica
text: Okay, umm-umm, I’ll just—I’ll be right back, I just gotta go ah, go ah…

speaker: Ross
text: A wandering?

speaker: Monica
text: Change! Okay, sit down. (Shows Paul in) Two seconds.

speaker: Phoebe
text: Ooh, I just pulled out four eyelashes. That can’t be good.
(Monica goes to change.)

speaker: Joey
text: Hey, Paul!

speaker: Paul
text: Yeah?

speaker: Joey
text: Here’s a little tip, she really likes it when you rub her neck in the same spot over and over and over again until it starts to get a little red.

speaker: Monica
text: Shut up, Joey!

speaker: Ross
text: So Rachel, what’re you, uh… what’re you up to tonight?

speaker: Rachel
text: Well, I was kinda supposed to be headed for Aruba on my honeymoon, so nothing!

speaker: Ross
text: Right, you’re not even getting your honeymoon, God.. No, no, although, Aruba, this time of year… talk about your- (thinks) -big lizards… Anyway, if you don’t feel like being alone tonight, Joey and Chandler are coming over to help me put together my new furniture.

speaker: Chandler
text: Yes, and we’re very excited about it.

speaker: Rachel
text: Well actually thanks, but I think I’m just gonna hang out here tonight. It’s been kinda a long day.

speaker: Ross
text: Okay, sure.

speaker: Joey
text: Hey Pheebs, you wanna help?

speaker: Phoebe
text: Oh, I wish I could, but I don’t want to.
[Scene: The Subway, Phoebe is singing for change.]

speaker: Phoebe
text: Love is sweet as summer showers, love is a wondrous work of art, but your love oh your love, your love…is like a giant pigeon…crapping on my heart. La-la-la-la-la- (some guy gives her some change and to that guy) Thank you. (sings) La-la-la-la…ohhh!

description: Ross’s Apartment, the guys are there assembling furniture.

speaker: Ross
text: I’m supposed to attach a brackety thing to the side things, using a bunch of these little worm guys. I have no brackety thing, I see no whim guys whatsoever and- I cannot feel my legs.
(Joey and Chandler are finishing assembling the bookcase.)

speaker: Joey
text: I’m thinking we’ve got a bookcase here.

speaker: Chandler
text: It’s a beautiful thing.

speaker: Joey
text: What’s this?

speaker: Chandler
text: I would have to say that is an ‘L’-shaped bracket.

speaker: Joey
text: Which goes where?

speaker: Chandler
text: I have no idea.
(Joey checks that Ross is not looking and dumps it in a plant.)

speaker: Joey
text: Done with the bookcase!

speaker: Chandler
text: All finished!

speaker: Ross
parenthetical: clutching a beer can and sniffing
text: This was Carol’s favorite beer. She always drank it out of the can, I should have known.

speaker: Joey
text: Hey-hey-hey-hey, if you’re gonna start with that stuff we’re outta here.

speaker: Chandler
text: Yes, please don’t spoil all this fun.

speaker: Joey
text: Ross, let me ask you a question. She got the furniture, the stereo, the good TV- what did you get?

speaker: Ross
text: You guys.

speaker: Chandler
text: Oh, God.

speaker: Joey
text: You got screwed.

speaker: Chandler
text: Oh my God!

description: A Restaurant, Monica and Paul are eating.

speaker: Monica
text: Oh my God!

speaker: Paul
text: I know, I know, I’m such an idiot. I guess I should have caught on when she started going to the dentist four and five times a week. I mean, how clean can teeth get?

speaker: Monica
text: My brother’s going through that right now, he’s such a mess. How did you get through it?

speaker: Paul
text: Well, you might try accidentally breaking something valuable of hers, say her-

speaker: Monica
text: -leg?

speaker: Paul
text: That’s one way! Me, I- I went for the watch.

speaker: Monica
text: You actually broke her watch? Wow! The worst thing I ever did was, I-I shredded by boyfriend’s favorite bath towel.

speaker: Paul
text: Ooh, steer clear of you.

speaker: Monica
text: That’s right. [Scene: Monica’s Apartment, Rachel is talking on the phone and pacing.]

speaker: Rachel
text: Barry, I’m sorry… I am so sorry… I know you probably think that this is all about what I said the other day about you making love with your socks on, but it isn’t… it isn’t, it’s about me, and I ju- (She stops talking and dials the phone.) Hi, machine cut me off again… anyway… look, look, I know that some girl is going to be incredibly lucky to become Mrs. Barry Finkel, but it isn’t me, it’s not me. And not that I have any idea who me is right now, but you just have to give me a chance too… (The maching cuts her off again and she redials.)

description: Ross’s Apartment; Ross is pacing while Joey and Chandler are working on some more furniture.

speaker: Ross
text: I’m divorced! I’m only 26 and I’m divorced!

speaker: Joey
text: Shut up!

speaker: Chandler
text: You must stop! (Chandler hits what he is working on with a hammer and it collapses.)

speaker: Ross
text: That only took me an hour.

speaker: Chandler
text: Look, Ross, you gotta understand, between us we haven’t had a relationship that has lasted longer than a Mento. You , however have had the love of a woman for four years. Four years of closeness and sharing at the end of which she ripped your heart out, and that is why we don’t do it! I don’t think that was my point!

speaker: Ross
text: You know what the scariest part is? What if there’s only one woman for everybody, y’know? I mean what if you get one woman- and that’s it? Unfortunately in my case, there was only one woman- for her…

speaker: Joey
text: What are you talking about? ‘One woman’? That’s like saying there’s only one flavor of ice cream for you. Lemme tell you something, Ross. There’s lots of flavors out there. There’s Rocky Road, and Cookie Dough, and Bing! Cherry Vanilla. You could get ’em with Jimmies, or nuts, or whipped cream! This is the best thing that ever happened to you! You got married, you were, like, what, eight? Welcome back to the world! Grab a spoon!

speaker: Ross
text: I honestly don’t know if I’m hungry or horny.

speaker: Chandler
text: Stay out of my freezer! [Scene: A Restaurant, Monica and Paul are still eating.]

speaker: Paul
text: Ever since she walked out on me, I, uh…

speaker: Monica
text: What?… What, you wanna spell it out with noodles?

speaker: Paul
text: No, it’s, it’s more of a fifth date kinda revelation.

speaker: Monica
text: Oh, so there is gonna be a fifth date?

speaker: Paul
text: Isn’t there?

speaker: Monica
text: Yeah… yeah, I think there is. -What were you gonna say?

speaker: Paul
text: Well, ever-ev-… ever since she left me, um, I haven’t been able to, uh, perform. (Monica takes a sip of her drink.) …Sexually.

speaker: Monica
parenthetical: spitting out her drink in shock
text: Oh God, oh God, I am sorry… I am so sorry…

speaker: Paul
text: It’s okay…

speaker: Monica
text: I know being spit on is probably not what you need right now. Um… how long?

speaker: Paul
text: Two years.

speaker: Monica
text: Wow! I’m-I’m-I’m glad you smashed her watch!

speaker: Paul
text: So you still think you, um… might want that fifth date?

speaker: Monica
text: …Yeah. Yeah, I do.

description: [Scene: Monica’s Apartment, Rachel is watching Joanne Loves Chaci.]

speaker: Priest on TV
text: We are gathered here today to join Joanne Louise Cunningham and Charles, Chachi-Chachi-Chachi, Arcola in the bound of holy matrimony.

speaker: Rachel
text: Oh…see… but Joanne loved Chachi! That’s the difference!

description: Ross’s Apartment, they’re all sitting around and talking.

speaker: Ross
text: Grab a spoon. Do you know how long it’s been since I’ve grabbed a spoon? Do the words ‘Billy, don’t be a hero’ mean anything to you?

speaker: Joey
text: Great story! But, I uh, I gotta go, I got a date with Andrea—Angela—Andrea… Oh man, (looks to Chandler)

speaker: Chandler
text: Angela’s the screamer, Andrea has cats.

speaker: Joey
text: Right. Thanks. It’s June. I’m outta here. (Exits.)

speaker: Ross
text: Y’know, here’s the thing. Even if I could get it together enough to- to ask a woman out,… who am I gonna ask? (He gazes out of the window.)
[Cut to Rachel staring out of her window.]

description: Monica’s Apartment, Rachel is making coffee for Joey and Chandler.

speaker: Rachel
text: Isn’t this amazing? I mean, I have never made coffee before in my entire life.

speaker: Chandler
text: That is amazing.

speaker: Joey
text: Congratulations.

speaker: Rachel
text: Y’know, I figure if I can make coffee, there isn’t anything I can’t do.

speaker: Chandler
text: If can invade Poland, there isn’t anything I can’t do.

speaker: Joey
text: Listen, while you’re on a roll, if you feel like you gotta make like a Western omelet or something… (Joey and Chandler taste the coffee, grimace, and pour it into a plant pot.) Although actually I’m really not that hungry…

speaker: Monica
text: Oh good, Lenny and Squigy are here.

speaker: All
text: Morning. Good morning.

speaker: Paul
text: Morning.

speaker: Joey
text: Morning, Paul.

speaker: Rachel
text: Hello, Paul.

speaker: Chandler
text: Hi, Paul, is it?
(Monica and Paul walk to the door and talk in a low voice so the others can’t hear. The others move Monica’s table closer to the door so that they can.)

speaker: Paul
text: Thank you! Thank you so much!

speaker: Monica
text: Stop!

speaker: Paul
text: No, I’m telling you last night was like umm, all my birthdays, both graduations, plus the barn raising scene in Witness .

speaker: Monica
text: We’ll talk later.

speaker: Paul
text: Yeah. (They kiss) Thank you. (Exits)

speaker: Joey
text: That wasn’t a real date?! What the hell do you do on a real date?

speaker: Monica
text: Shut up, and put my table back.

speaker: All
text: Okayyy! (They do so.)

speaker: Chandler
text: All right, kids, I gotta get to work. If I don’t input those numbers,… it doesn’t make much of a difference…

speaker: Rachel
text: So, like, you guys all have jobs?

speaker: Monica
text: Yeah, we all have jobs. See, that’s how we buy stuff.

speaker: Joey
text: Yeah, I’m an actor.

speaker: Rachel
text: Wow! Would I have seen you in anything?

speaker: Joey
text: I doubt it. Mostly regional work.

speaker: Monica
text: Oh wait, wait, unless you happened to catch the Reruns’ production of Pinocchio , at the little theater in the park.

speaker: Joey
text: Look, it was a job all right?

speaker: Chandler
text: ‘Look, Gippetto, I’m a real live boy.’

speaker: Joey
text: I will not take this abuse. (Walks to the door and opens it to leave.)

speaker: Chandler
text: You’re right, I’m sorry. (Burst into song and dances out of the door.) “ Once I was a wooden boy, a little wooden boy… ”

speaker: Joey
text: You should both know, that he’s a dead man. Oh, Chandler? (Starts after Chandler.)

speaker: Monica
text: So how you doing today? Did you sleep okay? Talk to Barry? I can’t stop smiling.

speaker: Rachel
text: I can see that. You look like you slept with a hanger in your mouth.

speaker: Monica
text: I know, he’s just so, so… Do you remember you and Tony DeMarco?

speaker: Rachel
text: Oh, yeah.

speaker: Monica
text: Well, it’s like that. With feelings.

speaker: Rachel
text: Oh wow. Are you in trouble.

speaker: Monica
text: Big time!

speaker: Rachel
text: Want a wedding dress? Hardly used.

speaker: Monica
text: I think we are getting a little ahead of selves here. Okay. Okay. I am just going to get up, go to work and not think about him all day. Or else I’m just gonna get up and go to work.

speaker: Rachel
text: Oh, look, wish me luck!

speaker: Monica
text: What for?

speaker: Rachel
text: I’m gonna go get one of those (Thinks) job things.
(Monica exits.)

description: Iridium, Monica is working as Frannie enters.

speaker: Frannie
text: Hey, Monica!

speaker: Monica
text: Hey Frannie, welcome back! How was Florida?

speaker: Frannie
text: You had sex, didn’t you?

speaker: Monica
text: How do you do that?

speaker: Frannie
text: Oh, I hate you, I’m pushing my Aunt Roz through Parrot Jungle and you’re having sex! So? Who?

speaker: Monica
text: You know Paul?

speaker: Frannie
text: Paul the Wine Guy? Oh yeah, I know Paul.

speaker: Monica
text: You mean you know Paul like I know Paul?

speaker: Frannie
text: Are you kidding? I take credit for Paul. Y’know before me, there was no snap in his turtle for two years.

description: Central Perk, everyone but Rachel is there.

speaker: Joey
parenthetical: sitting on the arm of the couch
text: Of course it was a line!

speaker: Monica
text: Why?! Why? Why, why would anybody do something like that?

speaker: Ross
text: I assume we’re looking for an answer more sophisticated than ‘to get you into bed’.

speaker: Monica
text: I hate men! I hate men!

speaker: Phoebe
text: Oh no, don’t hate, you don’t want to put that out into the universe.

speaker: Monica
text: Is it me? Is it like I have some sort of beacon that only dogs and men with severe emotional problems can hear?

speaker: Phoebe
text: All right, c’mere, gimme your feet. (She starts massaging them.)

speaker: Monica
text: I just thought he was nice, y’know?

speaker: Joey
text: I can’t believe you didn’t know it was a line!
(Monica pushes him off of the sofa as Rachel enters with a shopping bag.)

speaker: Rachel
text: Guess what?

speaker: Ross
text: You got a job?

speaker: Rachel
text: Are you kidding? I’m trained for nothing! I was laughed out of twelve interviews today.

speaker: Chandler
text: And yet you’re surprisingly upbeat.

speaker: Rachel
text: You would be too if you found John and David boots on sale, fifty percent off!

speaker: Chandler
text: Oh, how well you know me…

speaker: Rachel
text: They’re my new ‘I don’t need a job, I don’t need my parents, I’ve got great boots’ boots!

speaker: Monica
text: How’d you pay for them?

speaker: Rachel
text: Uh, credit card.

speaker: Monica
text: And who pays for that?

speaker: Rachel
text: Um… my… father.

description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone is sitting around the kitchen table. Rachel’s credit cards are spread out on the table along with a pair of scissors.

speaker: Rachel
text: Oh God, come on you guys, is this really necessary? I mean, I can stop charging anytime I want.

speaker: Monica
text: C’mon, you can’t live off your parents your whole life.

speaker: Rachel
text: I know that. That’s why I was getting married.

speaker: Phoebe
text: Give her a break, it’s hard being on your own for the first time.

speaker: Rachel
text: Thank you.

speaker: Phoebe
text: You’re welcome. I remember when I first came to this city. I was fourteen. My mom had just killed herself and my step-dad was back in prison, and I got here, and I didn’t know anybody. And I ended up living with this albino guy who was, like, cleaning windshields outside port authority, and then he killed himself, and then I found aromatherapy. So believe me, I know exactly how you feel.
(Pause)

speaker: Ross
text: The word you’re looking for is ‘Anyway’…

speaker: Monica
text: All right, you ready?

speaker: Rachel
text: No. No, no, I’m not ready! How can I be ready? “Hey, Rach! You ready to jump out the airplane without your parachute?” Come on, I can’t do this!

speaker: Monica
text: You can, I know you can!

speaker: Rachel
text: I don’t think so.

speaker: Ross
text: Come on, you made coffee! You can do anything! (Chandler slowly tries to hide the now dead plant from that morning when he and Joey poured their coffee into it.)

speaker: Ross
text: C’mon, cut. Cut, cut, cut,…

speaker: All
text: Cut, cut, cut, cut, cut, cut, cut… (She cuts one of them and they cheer.)

speaker: Rachel
text: Y’know what? I think we can just leave it at that. It’s kinda like a symbolic gesture…

speaker: Monica
text: Rachel! That was a library card!

speaker: All
text: Cut, cut, cut, cut, cut, cut, cut..

speaker: Chandler
parenthetical: as Rachel is cutting up her cards
text: Y’know, if you listen closely, you can hear a thousand retailers scream.
(She finishes cutting them up and they all cheer.)

speaker: Monica
text: Welcome to the real world! It sucks. You’re gonna love it!
[Time Lapse, Rachel and Ross are watching a TV channel finishes it’s broadcast day by playing the national anthem.]

speaker: Monica
text: Well, that’s it (To Ross) You gonna crash on the couch?

speaker: Ross
text: No. No, I gotta go home sometime.

speaker: Monica
text: You be okay?

speaker: Ross
text: Yeah.

speaker: Rachel
text: Hey Mon, look what I just found on the floor. (Monica smiles.) What?

speaker: Monica
text: That’s Paul’s watch. You just put it back where you found it. Oh boy. Alright. Goodnight, everybody.

speaker: Ross and Rachel
text: Goodnight.
(Monica stomps on Paul’s watch and goes into her room.)

speaker: Ross
text: Mmm. (They both reach for the last cookie) Oh, no-

speaker: Rachel
text: Sorry-

speaker: Ross
text: No no no, go-

speaker: Rachel
text: No, you have it, really, I don’t want it-

speaker: Ross
text: Split it?

speaker: Rachel
text: Okay.

speaker: Ross
text: Okay. (They split it.) You know you probably didn’t know this, but back in high school, I had a, um, major crush on you.

speaker: Rachel
text: I knew.

speaker: Ross
text: You did! Oh… I always figured you just thought I was Monica’s geeky older brother.

speaker: Rachel
text: I did.

speaker: Ross
text: Oh. Listen, do you think- and try not to let my intense vulnerability become any kind of a factor here- but do you think it would be okay if I asked you out? Sometime? Maybe?

speaker: Rachel
text: Yeah, maybe…

speaker: Ross
text: Okay… okay, maybe I will…

speaker: Rachel
text: Goodnight.

speaker: Ross
text: Goodnight.
(Rachel goes into her room and Monica enters the living room as Ross is leaving.)

speaker: Monica
text: See ya… Waitwait, what’s with you?

speaker: Ross
text: I just grabbed a spoon. (Ross exits and Monica has no idea what that means.)

speaker: Joey
text: I can’t believe what I’m hearing here.

speaker: Phoebe
text: I can’t believe what I’m hearing here…

speaker: Monica
text: What? I-I said you had a-

speaker: Phoebe
text: What I said you had…

speaker: Monica
text: Would you stop?

speaker: Phoebe
text: Oh, was I doing it again?

speaker: All
text: Yes!

speaker: Monica
text: I said that you had a nice butt, it’s just not a great butt.

speaker: Joey
text: Oh, you wouldn’t know a great butt if it came up and bit ya.

speaker: Ross
text: There’s an image.

speaker: Rachel
parenthetical: walks up with a pot of coffee
text: Would anybody like more coffee?

speaker: Chandler
text: Did you make it, or are you just serving it?

speaker: Rachel
text: I’m just serving it.

speaker: All
text: Yeah. Yeah, I’ll have a cup of coffee.

speaker: Chandler
text: Kids, new dream… I’m in Las Vegas. (Rachel sits down to hear Chandler’s dream.)

speaker: Customer
text: Ahh, miss? More coffee?

speaker: Rachel
text: Ugh. (To another customer that’s leaving.) Excuse me, could you give this to that guy over there? (Hands him the coffee pot.) Go ahead. (He does so.) Thank you. (To the gang.) Sorry. Okay, Las Vegas.

speaker: Chandler
text: Okay, so, I’m in Las Vegas… I’m Liza Minelli-
